application_type_full: Tree works: Trees in conservation areas/subject to TPOs
description: FRONT GARDEN	T1	Purple Leafed Plum (Prunus cerasifera 'Pissardii')	Fell to ground level and remove all arisings as tree is dead. REAR GARDEN	T2	Mullberry (Morus spp) - Crown Reduction - Reducing the height and spread of the tree by up to 2m to tidy and contain, helping to reduce end weight and preserve the tree by limiting the risk of limb failure. Final heightFinal spread 6mT3	Apple (Malus domestica)- Crown Reduction - Reducing the height and spread of the tree by approximately 2m to tidy and contain, helping to reduce end weight and limit the risk of limb failure. Remove major deadwood. Final height 5mFinal spread 4m	T4	Apple (Malus domestica) - Crown Reduction - Reducing the height and spread of the tree by approximately 2m, back to most recent previous reduction points to tidy and contain. Thin out through removal of water shoots. 	Final height 5mFinal spread 5mT5	Pear (Pyrus spp)- End weight reduction - Reducing select branches by up to 2m to help reduce end weight and preserve the tree by limiting the risk of limb failure. Final height 6mFinal spread 5mT6	Silk tassel bush (Garrya elliptica) - Heavily reduce side growing over flowerbed to create a flat face and limit overhang to flowerbed. Lightly trim remaining tree on side of No.101 High street only to tidy and shape, maintaining screening. Please note that the heavily pruned face of the tree will look very bare and unsightly initially, but in time it will put on some new growth and bush up. Final height 4mFinal spread 3mT7	Magnolia grandiflora - Lightly reduce by 0.5-1m to tidy and shape.Final height 4mFinal spread 2mT8	Quince (Cydonia oblonga) - Transplant Quince tree to a different location in the garden. See pictures for guidance.
site_name: Elm Grove House 101 High StreetHamptonTW12 2SX
